solution_line_template: After increasing the price of a piece of jewelry, the price increased from ${initial_jewelry_price} to ${initial_jewelry_price}+${jewelry_price_increase} = $<<{initial_jewelry_price}+{jewelry_price_increase}={new_jewelry_price}>>{new_jewelry_price} each.

He also increased the price of each painting by {painting_increase_percentage}*{initial_painting_price} = $<<{painting_increase_percentage}*{initial_painting_price}={painting_price_increase_amount}>>{painting_price_increase_amount}

The total price for buying one painting at the new price is ${initial_painting_price}+${painting_price_increase_amount} = $<<{initial_painting_price}+{painting_price_increase_amount}={new_painting_price}>>{new_painting_price}

If a buyer purchases {num_jewelry_pieces} pieces of jewelry, the total cost becomes {num_jewelry_pieces}*${new_jewelry_price} = $<<{num_jewelry_pieces}*{new_jewelry_price}={total_cost_jewelry}>>{total_cost_jewelry}
When the buyer also buys {num_paintings} paintings, he pays a total of ${new_painting_price}*{num_paintings} = $<<{new_painting_price}*{num_paintings}={total_cost_paintings}>>{total_cost_paintings}
2 pieces of jewelry and 5 paintings cost ${total_cost_paintings}+${total_cost_jewelry} = ${final_total_cost} at the new prices.
